name: Enable Server-Side Encryption with AWS KMS for SQS Queues
description: Ensure that all SQS queues have server-side encryption enabled using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs). This provides an additional layer of data protection for messages in transit and at rest.

name: Restrict SQS Queue Access to Specific AWS Accounts or Services
description: Ensure that SQS queue policies restrict access to only specified AWS accounts, IAM principals, or AWS services. This helps prevent unauthorized access to the queue and its messages.

name: Implement Least Privilege Access for SQS Queues
description: Ensure that IAM policies and SQS queue policies follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to authorized entities. Avoid using wildcard (*) permissions in queue policies.

name: Enable Dead-Letter Queues for SQS
description: Configure Dead-Letter Queues (DLQs) for SQS queues to capture and isolate messages that fail to be processed. This helps in troubleshooting and ensures that no messages are lost due to processing failures.

name: Implement SQS Queue Access Logging
description: Enable CloudWatch Logs for SQS to track and monitor queue access and usage patterns. This aids in security analysis, auditing, and troubleshooting.

name: Use VPC Endpoints for SQS Access
description: Configure VPC endpoints for SQS to enable secure, private communication between VPCs and SQS without traversing the public internet. This enhances security and reduces data transfer costs.

name: Implement Message Retention Period for SQS Queues
description: Set an appropriate message retention period for SQS queues to ensure messages are not stored indefinitely. This helps in managing storage costs and adhering to data retention policies.

name: Enable Server-Side Encryption in Transit for SQS
description: Ensure that all communication with SQS queues uses HTTPS (TLS) to encrypt data in transit. This protects the confidentiality and integrity of messages as they travel between clients and SQS.

name: Implement SQS Queue Tagging
description: Apply relevant tags to SQS queues for better resource organization, cost allocation, and access control. Use tags to identify critical queues that require additional security measures.

name: Configure SQS Queue Alarms
description: Set up CloudWatch alarms for SQS queues to monitor and alert on metrics such as ApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible, ApproximateAgeOfOldestMessage, and NumberOfMessagesSent. This helps in detecting abnormal queue behavior or potential security issues.
